Question: This person sought to practice non-violence and truth in all situations, and advocated that others do the same.
Hints: This person was arrested on 10 March 1922, tried for sedition, and sentenced to six years' imprisonment.
This person had also refused to support the untouchables in 1924–25 when they were campaigning for the right to pray in temples.
Because of this person's actions, Ambedkar described him as "devious and untrustworthy".
